attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP
attributes.background: I propose we reduce the Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP then put those savings into NHS, Policing, Armed Forces, Schools & Infra-structure in equal proportions.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently put 0.7% of our GDP into Foreign Aid, which is ok when we can afford it but the needs of our Country must come first.
It is the duty of the Government to put the security of the nation first that means increasing the funding for our Armed Forces.
It is also the duty of our Government to ensure the safety of its people that means increasing the funding for our Police.
Until our Road networks are repaired, our Hospitals upgraded, our schools rebuilt and our Police and Armed Forces are fully equipped to defend our Nation the reduce Foreign Aid Budget should remain.
Once we have rebuilt these vital services we can once again increase our Foreign Aid budget on the understanding that it is fully audited and overseen by our Armed Forces, that way we can see how our money is spent

attributes.action: Make basic equality training a legal requirement for businesses
attributes.background: The equality act 2010 is a wonderful piece of legislation that protects people from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: If you've ever been treated unfairly due to your disability, age, race or gender, it is there to protect you but what happens when someone or a company does it and refuses to change? Nothing a lot of the time and it's not right! People and companies need to be educated on the equality act and make reasonable adjustments where necessary.

attributes.action: No military action in Syria until perpetrators of chemical attacks are verified.
attributes.background: Involvement in missile strikes or other military action against the Syrian government will escalate the conflict, resulting in yet greater loss of life. Please hold back until we know more.

attributes.action: Legally require the Net Internal Floor area to be quoted for every home on sale.
attributes.background: Homes in Britain are traded in terms of rooms rather than floor space. This lack of clear information is a source of market failure. British homes are getting more cramped and less fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: There are no minimum space standards for new housing in Britain. Research by CABE and LABC Warranty shows that developers are making homes smaller and smaller. New homes lack space for family meals, for childrens play and homework, and for storage. Quoting the Net Internal Floor area (e.g. as defined by the Valuation Office Agency) would help buyers understand exactly what they are getting, make objective comparisons, and identify value for money.

attributes.action: Make 30th November a national holiday in memory of Sir Winston Churchill
attributes.background: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill, was a great national hero. A man who epitomized the British spirit during one of our nation's darkest times. In honour of this man, his birthday each year should be made a national holiday to commemorate him.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for motorbikes to have different coloured headlamps to cars
attributes.background: Driving at night, in heavy traffic or in wet weather it is often difficult to differentiate a motorbike weaving down between lanes from other cars.  If motorbikes had a different coloured headlamp (yellow maybe), drivers, incl. other riders, looking in rear/side view mirrors would better spot them.
attributes.additional_details: I think this would significantly improve road safety by reducing the number of car accidents with motorbikes when they are not seen by drivers joining / changing lanes in heavy traffic.  The headlight colour would obviously need to be one that would afford the bike rider equal visibility.

attributes.action: Ban the production and sale of non-recycled toilet paper in this country.
attributes.background: All of us use toilet paper every day.  Has it ever occurred to you that most toilet paper is made from new trees?  Recycled toilet paper is not widely available in shops in this country.  It should be the only option available because of the huge negative impact it has on the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some facts (http://www.theworldcounts.com/counters/how_consumerism_affects_the_environment/toilet_paper_environmental_impact):

- The toilet paper we use could go around the planet every 2 minutes, or travel to the sun and back every 10 days.

- The difference between using new toilet paper and toilet paper made from recycled materials is 400 million trees, 660 million tons of water, and 45 million tons of oil.

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Make A levels 3 years. This is to avoid psychological stress for young people.
attributes.background: Governments should take initiative to create this legislation as it would decrease psychological stress for young people.The psychological health of the youth is worrying with many dropping out and wanting to end their lives. We need to support the youth to create a more skilled workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
Today several aspects of young people’s quality of life and lack of well-being in this latest update has increased with over 42 .2% of 16-
19 year old experiencing anxiety which in many cases relates to education. 231 people committed suicide in 2017 due to exam stress while many other attempted to take their own life. We need to help our youth as these are the people of tomorrow. All life is precious so it must be safeguarded by us the people.

attributes.action: Nationalise the 3rd party element of vehicle insurance to benefit young drivers.
attributes.background: My partner's daughter's insurance was £2000 per annum for any car before any accidents at the age of 18. She now has had an accident that wasn't her fault and the new premium will be £4000 per annum. She cannot use public transport to get to her job. This premium represents more than half her wages.
attributes.additional_details: Any alternative system exists in New Zealand and is quoted by Wikipedia as follows - "Within New Zealand, the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC) provides nationwide no-fault personal injury insurance.[9] Injuries involving motor vehicles operating on public roads are covered by the Motor Vehicle Account, for which premiums are collected through levies on petrol and through vehicle licensing fees."

attributes.action: Privatise the NHS.
attributes.background: The privatisation of the NHS would mean taxes could be cut immensely or go to other areas. The privatisation would save money for the people as it will create more competition in the private market forcing lower prices for the competitive advantage of having cheaper care for the people.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS costs the average person £5,000 per year in taxes; the average person goes to the doctor's 4 times per year. If this was privatised then you would pay roughly £50 per visit, which is £200 per year. (This is based off American prices converted to pounds.) That is a lot of money to be saved per person. This extra money could grant lower taxes or more money going to other areas.

attributes.action: Make all school "Keep Clear" markings mandatory zones instead of advisory.
attributes.background: Too many people ignore the Keep Clear markings around school entrances as currently they are advisory unless accompanied by signage and enforced by the local Councils. Making them compulsory No Parking zones would make school entrances safer for all.

attributes.action: More funding for a cure for patients suffering with IBD
attributes.background: The two main forms of inflammatory bowel disease are Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis. Both are chronic diseases that cause inflammation of the digestive system. As well as these intestinal problems, the disease may be associated with abnormalities of the joints, eyes, liver and skin.
attributes.additional_details: Crohn’s disease is the inflammation of the digestive system which leads to diarrhoea, abdominal pain, tiredness and weight loss. Ulcerative colitis is a lifelong disease that is associated with significant morbidity. With Ulcerative Colitis being the most common of the two most patients are diagnosed under the age of 25. Having the start of our lives filled with doctors appointments, hospital apppointments, to be used on clinical trials for drugs that can only surpress and not cure our illness.

attributes.action: Ban Admin Fees on Insurance Policies for Legal Need to report Change of Address
attributes.background: When people move house and need to report a legal change to their address circumstances, this should NOT be subjected to punitive fees by profiteering or hidden smallprint in contracts.
attributes.additional_details: Most insurance companies now deliver documents via PDF electronically. This no longer costs them postage. A change of address is a legal requirement (along with Driving Licence and DVLA registration) Charging people a punitive administration fee for complying with the LAW only encourages people to break the law until a policy renews. Simple address changes should be exempt from these Fees irrespective of refunds/increases in policy calculations.

attributes.action: Ban Cryptocurrency
attributes.background: Cryptocurrency such as Bitcoin is a payment method that is used in Dark Web to make make payments for criminal transactions such as fake notes, passports and even drugs. This need to be banned to clean up our society so that no criminal activity using this payment method takes place in the UK.

attributes.action: Changing a man's name after marriage.
attributes.background: Currently in the UK men are unable to use a marriage certificate as proof to change their name when taking their wife's last name. However woman are allowed to use a marriage certificate as proof to take the mans name. A man has to change his name by deed poll, a woman does not.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe in equality and for that reason a marriage certificate should be proof enough to change your name even if you are a man taking your wife's name, or a man taking your husband's name. 

Lets break the tradition and make a change.

attributes.action: Reform the UK prison system by adopting a more rehabilitative approach.
attributes.background: The UK prison system is failing. It does not meet the aims of punishment or prevention and doesn't even act as a deterrent as 47% of people leaving prison reoffend within a year (70% for those U18). This needs to change and we propose the change can come from more actively rehabilitating offenders..
attributes.additional_details: Rehabilitating offenders equips them with skills necessary to enter the world of employment. 50% of offenders have a reading age below 11 and 82% have a writing age below 11. To manage everyday tasks people need a reading age above 11 and so once offenders serve their sentence, they re-enter society with the same lack of skills they entered with. This means that they are likely to get involved with things that led them to prison in the first place, resulting in reoffending. Things must change!

attributes.action: UK residents with ILR to access EU passport or fast track queues at UK Borders
attributes.background: UK residents lose considerable time and productivity to long queues at UK Borders. A registered traveller scheme exists for frequent non-resident visitors from several countries to access faster clearance at the Border. A similar system should be implemented free of charge for residents with ILR.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/registered-traveller/eligibility

attributes.action: Build a Channel bridge between UK & France, to increase trade as we leave the EU
attributes.background: Build a Channel bridge between Britain and France to vastly increase trade between not just these two countries, but the entirety of Europe also. During uncertain times as we leave the European Union, such a project would reassure voters with increased economic confidence for the future.
attributes.additional_details: Would allow for easier access into both countries, making trade between UK and Europe much more easier.

attributes.action: pay state pensions into pensioners bank accounts on the day they are due
attributes.background: if your state pension is due on say the 15th it should be in the pensinors account on the 15th  not up to 15 days later
attributes.additional_details: my state pension is allways received 5-10 days late and the pension centre say this is normal?

attributes.action: Restore expatriate Pensioners in Spain their Winter Fuel Allowance.
attributes.background: Expat Pensioners have paid into the system and require parity with Pensioners in the UK. If it is right for UK residents it must be right for Spanish expatriates to receive their allowance.
attributes.additional_details: When the temperatures drop in winter, as they do in the UK, pensioners in Spain need to burn wood to keep their homes warm - homes that have been designed to remain cold in summer become very cold in winter. A great many pensioners are not wealthy but just about surviving on their meagre pension income. The seasonal temperature variation can be as much as 50 + centrigade with the temperatures falling below 0 degrees centigrade when the Sun sets in the Winter season.

attributes.action: Change legislation around air pollution caused by fireworks, to improve health.
attributes.background: It’s the beginning of a new year and in many countries around the world, it has become a tradition to set off thousands of fireworks in elaborate displays. But if we stopped to consider the environmental impact of such extravagance, would we still choose this option or go for a safer, greener option
attributes.additional_details: Firework smoke has been shown to significantly increase breathing problems and have increased toxicity compared to traffic pollution. In this technologically advanced world we live in, surely we have the ability to come up with more inventive ways of using music, lights, and water displays to commemorate the new year.  In 2018, authorities in Dubai opted to light up the Burj Khalifa in a sensational display without fireworks, proving it can be done. We could save millions & our health-pls sign.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of money that a person signed off work on sick pay receives.
attributes.background: I'm currently receiving sick pay of £360 a month, due to being hit by a car off my motorcycle by a car driver resulting in breaking my shoulder. The £360 a month that i receive soon disappears due to bills and it's very hard to live off of this amount of money a month, when i physically cannot work.
attributes.additional_details: I'm creating this petition to help others in my situation, who physically cannot work due to a motor vehicle accident. Crashes, accidents and injuries sometimes cannot be helped, if you've been injured from the same case to mine or one similar, why should the injured party suffer due to carelessness of another person? It's certainly not fair that the injured party has to live off of £360 a month when the other person can go back to work and earn their standard living wages a month.

attributes.action: Televise Government lobby briefings
attributes.background: With trust in both politicians and the mainstream media at an all time low,  government lobby briefings should be televised to demonstrate a true record of what has taken place.
attributes.additional_details: The public are sceptical that lobby briefings as reported are a true reflection of the exchanges, as can be seen from the White House press briefings, what is said is available for anyone to view impartially without media bias.

attributes.action: I want a Royal Commision to examine the Obesity Crisis in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: UK obesity dates from the almost total collapse of the once World leading UK pottery industry in Stoke on Trent. A typical plate increased from 9.5 inches to 11 inches dia. That holds 40% more nosh & we led a much more active life; no Ipads and stuff then!

attributes.action: Make the Tax-Free Childcare service more transparent for Childcare Providers
attributes.background: There is a complete lack of communication about payments that have been made through Tax-Free Childcare. Providers have an account they can login to, but cannot see any payments that have been made to them.
attributes.additional_details: We rely on parents telling us they have made a payment, and then have to wait until the money is credited to our bank account which can take several working days. We do not get any notification about when a payment is made, and if we call the helpline we are told that information cannot be shared about any pending payments due to data protection. Even on our bank statements, it does not say who the payment has come from. We cannot operate a business like this.

attributes.action: Stop councils having to pay when planning decisions are overturned on appeal
attributes.background: Having spoken to local councillors it would appear the councils are becoming unwilling to deny planning because of the costs involved if overturned at appeal. This needs to stop or will end up with councils unwilling to do their best for the people, purely based on money.
attributes.additional_details: I feel the need to ask this question having been witness to the completely inappropriate and ill advised project to double the size of a small village in North Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Create a devolved parliament for the county of Devon
attributes.background: Devon has for too long been put at the bottom of the agenda by the out-of-touch Government in Westminster. We have received far too little in the way of funding for education and the NHS. A devolved assembly would allow us to decide on issues like tax, agriculture housing and education.
attributes.additional_details: The Government at Westminster has for too long now shown a complete lack of regard for The South West and Devon in particular. And despite promises, our hospitals, schools and infrastructure has been underfunded and it is making the people of Devon frustrated. Our pupils are underfunded, local hospitals are being forced to close and our railway system is dreadful, with projects planned before WWII that still haven't been completed. We want a more prosperous Devon inside a fairer united Kingdom.

attributes.action: All England, Scotland and Wales national team games available on freeview TV
attributes.background: I am English and I want to see my national team play.  I follow Rugby Union but I am unable to see live coverage of England games during the Rugby Union autumn international tests because I have to subscribe to SKY.

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Ensure Cricket Test Matches played by England are on Terrestrial TV.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State should amend the Group B list of events to include Cricket Test Matches played by England, instead of “in England”.
attributes.additional_details: It always used to be the case that sporting events of national significance had to be shown in some form (live or substantial highlights) on terrestrial television. For the first time BT has a monopoly on both live and highlight packages of the Ashes.

attributes.action: Make Falconry in the UK licensed.
attributes.background:
Here in the UK, we are one of the only countries in the world, that does not have a falconry license.
There is a huge issue where anyone can own and breed and sell birds of prey, to people who have no experience. 
I encounter 10-12 owls and Hawks each year kept in parrot cages and rabbit hutches
attributes.additional_details:
There's 1000s of people who have birds of prey, some of these birds can kill animals up the the size of deer, so effectively they're equivalent to a dangerous weapon. 
There needs to be control on the ownership or at the least, a strict mentoring system.

attributes.action: Prohibit operating tractors & other agricultural vehicles between 07:30 - 09:00
attributes.background: A tailback of cars stretching miles behind a tractor during rush hour in the morning is a sight many of the British public are accustomed to. Their use not only causes huge delays to travel times but puts other drivers at risk of incident as a result of forced manoeuvre.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have experienced considerable delays due to these vehicles, whose operation at peak rush hour is generally dispensible and subservient at these hours. Tractors also breed anger into the drivers who are stuck behind them, with no hope of manoeuvring unless subjecting themselves to an incident. The difference in time between agricultural vehicles travelling at 8am rather than 9am is negligible and should be considered when contemplating this petition.

attributes.action: Abolish inheritance tax
attributes.background:
It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again.

attributes.action: End any form of Monarchy in the UK and end all payments to the Royal Family.
attributes.background: Considering the financial state of the UK and with costs being cut left, right and centre is it perhaps time we cut one of the largest expenses? The Queen receives a HUGE payment from the tax payers of the United Kingdom on top of profits made from her own private lands. Both in the millions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Royal Family spend millions on travel, renovations and many luxuries. These costs don't include the hiring of security, among other things such as Royal Weddings. 
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/jun/27/queens-income-rises-to-82m-to-cover-cost-of-buckingham-palace-works
https://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/how-much-royal-family-cost-14111218

attributes.action: Raise Awarness for Morgellons Disease and co infections eg: Lymes Disease
attributes.background: I was bitten by a tick in the uk in 2011 I didn’t seek treatment as I didn’t no the risks. I was very ill over a number of years losing my hair etc. It was only when fibres started to come from my skin that I was diagnosed with Morgellons Disease a chronic form of Lymes Disease caused by the tick
attributes.additional_details: I am now under treatment but can’t be cured. Yet this Disease is still not recognised as a genuine illness as over the years patients have been dismissed as being dillusional. I am under a Dermatologist at the Royal London Hospital. Who states this is not a dillusion! The Disease needs listing on the rare disease register

attributes.action: Refund the application fee for all unsuccessful British Citizenship applications
attributes.background: As a single mother, I used my life savings to apply for British application of myself and my daughter. I denied myself of basic necessities. The Home Office refused our application and took the whole money. I can’t stop thinking about it, this has led to depression and insomnia.
attributes.additional_details: A small admin fee would be reasonable for them to keep, but not the whole fee.

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. It’s not fair to have to sit a test and pay £1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay £1330 to become naturalised. I’ve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Change the gcse scheme back to A,B,C instead of grades 9-1 so it’s easier
attributes.background: The students currently about to take GCSEs have been studying from year 7 up to get an A+ or etc all of a sudden the mark scheme has been changed which is not fair. The government have made it too hard for them to achieve in such small time.
attributes.additional_details: We need to make it easier so more students are able to be more successful in life. Changing the grading scheme has not made it only harder for children to be more successful but has also put more stress on them as the government had only changed it recently.

attributes.action: Require all toll bridges to treat disabled people equally
attributes.background: The Government must require parity for all disabled people to use toll bridges and roads for free, not just those on Disability Living Allowance. For example, I’m disabled but too old to qualify for disability living allowance which means I can’t use the Dartford river crossing for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a blue badge holder I can go through London without paying the congestion charge surely it should be the same using the Dartford river crossing. This is free for people who receive Disability Living Allowance and has an exemption from paying vehicle tax as a result. However anyone in my position is still required to pay due to being too old to apply for Disability Living Allowance.

attributes.action: Extend the remit of Employment Tribunals to include all equality-related cases
attributes.background: Employment Tribunals should become Employment & Equality Tribunals and hear all equality-related cases. Why have an Equality Act if only employees have access to legal redress? The Government must ensure that everyone, including pensioners and students, has equal access to justice at equal cost.
attributes.additional_details: The additional burden on the tribunal system would be small compared with the huge difference the change would make to those suffering breaches of the law. If the government won't extend the remit, they must explain why disabled students have fewer rights than disabled employees. An employee with a discrimination claim can go to the tribunal, but if someone other than their employer discriminates against them, they have to file an expensive claim in the County Court or the High Court.

attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and “Legalese” is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Require drivers aged 70 + to undergo an annual road safety check and eye exam.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers aged 70 and over should have to have annual safety assessment by a qualified driving instructor, and an eye examination by an optometrist, both of whom will submit a report to the DVLA to allow them to hold their license for the following twelve months.

attributes.action: If you are an English citizen, you should not have to pay to attend university.
attributes.background: In Scotland, you do not have to pay to attend university, however, English citizens have to pay extortionate amounts just to get education. Without this education, many young people will not get the chances that their futures' deserve. You can change all this with just a vote.

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Introduce Emotional Assistance Pet Act to prevent suicides and help families!
attributes.background:
The legislation that allows the emotional support animal access in housing facilities, even when the complex has a no pet policy already exists in the US. So literally we are not discovering an America here.
The petition is simply a trigger for Parliament to introduce it into the UK legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
It is known that the highest rates of suicide are associated with depressive disorders. 

The human-animal emotional bond does not differ from the one that we sustain in relation to close family members i.e. our own children.

There is also Article 8 of the Human Rights Act that provides the right to respect for one’s established family life (no pre-determined model of a family or family life)

Being cut off from your pet (family member) is increasing the risk of depression.
http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: Conduct rolling referenda so that the Brexit deal commands support AT THE TIME
attributes.background: Older voters, who were more likely to have died by the time 'Leave' takes effect, tended to favour 'Leave', whilst those under the age of 18, who will live much longer with the consequences, didn't get a vote at all.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is to conduct a potentially rolling sequence of referenda to ensure that the final outcome from the Brexit negotiations reflects the widest possible support AT THE TIME THE FINAL DEAL COMES INTO EFFECT.

There are 4 options. 1. Take the deal. 2. Re-negotiate 3. Stay in the EU 4. Leave with no agreement.

The voters rank the options in order of preference.

When one option commands more than 50 percent of the votes, or if the top option is 2, re-negotiate, that's what HMG will action.

Otherwise the option with the fewest votes is eliminated, and its supporters' votes are re-allocated to their next preferences.

If option 2, re-negotiate, wins, there would have to be a further referendum 3 months later, conducted as above.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.
